parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To speak evil of, rail at, slander. From katalalos; to be a traducer, i.e. To slander.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From kata and aischunomai; to shame down, i.e. Disgrace or put to the blush.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life. From anastrepho; behavior.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
